SummaryEnglish: Enjoy the hilarious adventures and misadventures of Bernard, a curious and comic polar bear that travels the world learning about us. Bernard transforms something as simple as taking a picture, facing a rainstorm or playing golf into a funny and difficult challenge.

1.SummaryEnglish: Nominated for and winner of the award for The Best Film for Children, the CG film Mug Travel was produced by RG Animation Studios and is a wonderful film adaptation of the computer animated television Backkom Series [related A.I. news: ""Backkom" Goes International"]. Directed by Lim Ah-ron, Mug Travel follows the character Bebe, who lonely one Christmas Eve comes into possession of a magical pendant, which with the help of a strange mug that has the magical power of transportation, embarks upon a fantastical voyage. Bebe, a baby, explores everything from deserts to forests to valleys and much more. Creativity and originality follow Bebe and other characters Konkongee (penguin), Backkom (polar bear) and many more animals; many of these characters of which do more harm than help. Ultimately quite frustrating in their travels and annoying one another to no end, working together and adjusting to change are tackled with the unconventional humor and curios directorial strategies of Director Lim Ah-ron are at the forefront of Mug Travel.
Bernard goes to the gym and starts training enthusiastically.

2.SummaryEnglish: Bernard experiences the powerful attraction of the golf course.

3.SummaryEnglish: Bernard sets off to climb the highest peak but it's tricker the closer he gets to the top.

4.SummaryEnglish: Bernard finds a beautiful tree with a swing. But someone else has got there first.

5.SummaryEnglish: Bernard is very familiar with the exhibits in the museum where he works.

6.SummaryEnglish: Sportsmanship is about knowing how to win and how to lose.

7.SummaryEnglish: Bernard desperately tries to copy all the things that Lloyd the penguin enjoys doing.

8.SummaryEnglish: Whatever the time, wherever he is, Bernard is completely hooked on television.

10.SummaryEnglish: If Bernard ever jumps out of the plane, he's bound to forget his parachute.

11.SummaryEnglish: Bernard just wants to have a good time at the theme park.

12.SummaryEnglish: It looks like rain, but Bernard's not worried because he's got his umbrella.

13.SummaryEnglish: Bernard is learning to fly, and may not have chosen the best day.

14.SummaryEnglish: Bernard wants to watch a movie, but an UFO forces him to change his plans.

16.SummaryEnglish: Animated adventures. There's nothing Bernard likes better than a challenge.

18.SummaryEnglish: Bowling Bernard the bowling champ takes on a clumsy challenger.

19.SummaryEnglish: Animated adventures. Bernard decides to learn Taekwondo.

20.SummaryEnglish: Bernard looks forward to a day's scuba diving.

21.SummaryEnglish: Most people can negotiate revolving doors, but Bernard is not quite like everyone else.

22.SummaryEnglish: Bernard pays a visit to a museum.

24.SummaryEnglish: Bernard finds himself on a desert island and alienates the locals.

25.SummaryEnglish: Bernard runs into trouble with the baseball pitching machine.

28.SummaryEnglish: Animated adventures of Bernard the Polar Bear. Bernard finds a medallion.

29.SummaryEnglish: Bernard's kitchen is invaded by a moth.

30.SummaryEnglish: Despite his lack of experience Bernard decides to try some bull fighting.

31.SummaryEnglish: Miles of arctic wasteland are boring Bernard.

32.SummaryEnglish: Zack tries to steal a parcel which Bernard is carrying, and at first he succeeds.

33.SummaryEnglish: Bernard discovers that he has been sleepwalking.

36.SummaryEnglish: Bernard has been shipwrecked, but his real problems begin when he finds a motorboat.

37.SummaryEnglish: Bernard makes a daring escape from prison.

38.SummaryEnglish: Bernard is delighted with the bargains he has bought. The problem is how to get them home.

39.SummaryEnglish: Bernard feels very tired and wants to sleep for hours, but there's a mosquito about.

40.SummaryEnglish: In the middle of the desert Bernard stumbles across an oasis. The palm trees look real.

41.SummaryEnglish: A map may lead to hidden treasure, but does not always mention the hidden dangers.

42.SummaryEnglish: Bernard is cleaning the windows of a skyscraper when he disturbs two birds.

43.SummaryEnglish: Children's animation. Bernard, Zack and Lloyd are competing in a marathon.

46.SummaryEnglish: Animated adventures. A UFO appears on Bernard's radar.

47.SummaryEnglish: Animation. Goliath may be tiny but he packs an oversize charge of aggression.

48.SummaryEnglish: Is it possible for an accident prone polar bear to have a lucky day?

49.SummaryEnglish: Bernard has a polar home on the ice cap, but is forced to leave after a storm.

50.SummaryEnglish: A robot seems to offer Bernard a simple solution to the problem of cleaning his house.

51.SummaryEnglish: When the vacuum cleaner finishes its work, there's no sign of Bernard's lottery ticket.

52.SummaryEnglish: Animated adventures of Bernard the polar bear. Bernard wants to enjoy nature.
